Articles.Content:
Yeah the mousewheel scrolling is somthing that is so utterly missing in the stock partlist, please don't give the mod up.

Also sorting the parts is much nicer and more customizable than the stock version.

I also think that PartCatalog was quite nifty (even though the lately changes in stock sorting). Mouse scroll was already mentioned, brilliantly simple, and yet so great. The other thing I did adore was sorting via mod folder name instead of manufacturer (some mods use stock manufacturers for their parts, and sorting via that becomes painful). And third last thing. I simply loved the menu nesting tree like setup. Well... thats all from me. I would personally love to see this mod updated to 0.90.
PartCatalog's sorting is still better than the new flavor of sorting - hope that Squad either starts thinking about how people actually look for parts, or that PC stays alive!

Gonna second what everyone else said so far While the new features of the editor are nice, I like PC's implementation better (by mod folder) And of course mouse scroll wheel to move through pages! Its hard to live without that.

The other thing I did adore was sorting via mod folder name instead of manufacturer (some mods use stock manufacturers for their parts, and sorting via that becomes painful).

Well, didnt realized that before.. This coudl really be mess.

Blacknecro, please dont give up the mod

If nothing else PLEASE at least make a separate mod that enables the mouse scrolling functionality. And not just the mouse scrolling between pages, but the shift+scroll functionality that allows you to scroll through the categories as well. The scrolling feature is my absolute favorite feature for workflow. I can literally build almost twice as fast with the scroll feature. It allows me to very quickly jump categories and pages to find the part I need with almost zero thought. With the 0.90 update I am constantly flicking my scroll wheel expecting to jump to the next page only to be deeply saddened by the lack of page turning. Having to manually click through the pages and categories is so utterly cumbersome after getting accustomed to the beauty that is PartCatalog's page scrolling feature. It would be a terrible tragedy to lose the feature forever.

I forgot about one more super-duper boosting efficiency part of the mod. A textfield search. It was so much faster just to type BATT (or im BATTMAN) if you were to find most of the batteries really quick. Same with RCS or other things, that have the needed stuff in their name. I think, that I haven't seen a seach thingy in stock sorting mechanics (or perhaps I'm blind).

I'll join the chorus and say I love the scroll and search functions.

I already miss them in 0.90 and it'd be lovely to have them, whether standalone or in some version of Part Catalog.

One way or another, lets see what the new version brings, but I guess that means PartCatalog is EoL then.

I definitely think you should update and adapt this mod to the new interface, multiple things it does better.

Ill jump on the train and say that I would still rather have .25 interface + pc vs .90 interface. I like the direction they went with the interface, but its still not enough.

Please maintain this mod. Or document what you have so someone else can take over.

Personally I find that playing in "0.90" without "ParCatalog" it's horrible when we installed mods ...

Please, continue development !

It may be possible to adapt to the interface of the new editor.

The funny thing is, that .25 interface (top) + pc = was actually more workspace. Now top is missing (lol dota2), and workarea is shrunken by the vertical interface.

To conclude. PC =

* sorting via mod folder name

* tree like structure for finding parts (great sorting, nice icons, if only it would be scrollable if too many mods used)

* including and excluding mod parts to list (+ tree like structure for each picked branch)

* textarea search parts

* mouse scroll on part pages

Cold facts

Edited December 18, 2014 by Ald
I would like to add my voice of support to continuing the development of this mod... the new stock part catalog, while an improvement, is still not as good as PartCatalog is.

There is definitely still a need for this mod, and/or improvement on the stock catalog. First , the sort by manufacturers tab is useless because it doesn't include mods (which it should). I have no idea what manufactuers make the stock Lv909 or the blah blah whatever. Now if those tabs were set to each Mod maker, that would be a different story.

The sort by resources tab is just an absolute freaking nightmare when you've installed more than a couple of mods. I've got a hundred resource tabs with 1 or 2 parts in each. And a bunch that are just empty. UUUUUggghgghghg.

Not to mention the only way to sort custom tabs is to delete and remake them.

So yeah.. Parts Catalog integration would be awesome if it's even possible.

...the only way to sort custom tabs is to delete and remake them...

It doesn't affect the strength of your point, because I agree that it's still obnoxious, but this might save you some grief in the meantime:

You can go in and edit the text file directly at GameData\Squad\PartList to adjust the tab order. (This is also where you can add more icons I believe.)

I created an account here just to add my voice in support of this mod being continued. It *rocks* compared to the stock .90 interface.

I'm a part junkie (Not part time junkie, a junkie who likes parts!) The .90 stock interface is damned near useless compared to Part Catalog, IMO.

To get this straight out of the box I won't update the current PartCatalog codebase, would be just madness to try and merge it in the new stock editor.

But after playing with 0.90 a bit I'll need some solution for this stock mess and was pretty much the same reason I started PartCatalog.

I can't promise anything especially not fast but I will probably work on this issue and if it ends up as something remotely usable I'll make sure to let you know.

Guess I'll spend the evening digging through the new stock editor stuff and see whether I can shape it into something useful.
That sounds like the sanest way to tackle it. Thanks!

Fair enough - you'd know best what will and won't work, but I will add my voice of encouragement - I find PC a much better solution. The in game "thing" is like many knockoffs - someone sees something being successful, and makes a very low quality analogue. I appreciate they tried, but they didn't succeed really.

To get this straight out of the box I won't update the current PartCatalog codebase, would be just madness to try and merge it in the new stock editor.

But after playing with 0.90 a bit I'll need some solution for this stock mess and was pretty much the same reason I started PartCatalog.

I can't promise anything especially not fast but I will probably work on this issue and if it ends up as something remotely usable I'll make sure to let you know.

Guess I'll spend the evening digging through the new stock editor stuff and see whether I can shape it into something useful.

Thanks you
I would also like to use the Part Catalog again. Stock is a Mess

I would kiss* anyoneÃ‚Â´s feet virtually if they can give me back mouse wheel scrolling in the part pages.

I, too, loved the mouse scrolling, but to me the big issue is the sorting. OMG the new stock sorting is unusable. With a half dozen mods and no way to sort by mod folder I can't find anything. Sort by mfg is useless. I cannot find anything in the new stock part list. Its a total disaster. I need my PartCatalog back. I'm nearly to the point of shelving KSP until something happens with part sorting that I can make sense of.

I, too, loved the mouse scrolling, but to me the big issue is the sorting. OMG the new stock sorting is unusable. With a half dozen mods and no way to sort by mod folder I can't find anything. Sort by mfg is useless. I cannot find anything in the new stock part list. Its a total disaster. I need my PartCatalog back. I'm nearly to the point of shelving KSP until something happens with part sorting that I can make sense of.

i got to admit i have the same problem i thought the editor changes where supposed to make things easier? EPIC FAIL imo

I, too, loved the mouse scrolling, but to me the big issue is the sorting. OMG the new stock sorting is unusable. With a half dozen mods and no way to sort by mod folder I can't find anything. Sort by mfg is useless. I cannot find anything in the new stock part list. Its a total disaster. I need my PartCatalog back. I'm nearly to the point of shelving KSP until something happens with part sorting that I can make sense of.

You can make your own categories... if you have 10 hours to spare... because you have to add every part to the appropriate category, one by one, in the same way that you add a subassembly.
